section.title: Overview
section.abstract: This is a site of constructive positivist philosophy. A modern positivism which I call metaphyical positivism is presented, together with some more general historical material on positivism. The "constructive" element is the attempt to understand knowledge by thinking about how machines might reason, and by devising a rational architecture for reasoning artefacts. This is accompanied by some material on the history of the automation of reasoning and its connections with logic, philosophy, mathematics, computing and engineering.
